cards.name: Abomination
cards.text: Whenever Abomination blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The color of the blocking/blocked creature is checked only at declaration of the block. If the creature is green or white at that time, it will be destroyed at end of combat even if it changes color before combat ends.

cards.originalText: At the end of combat, destroy all green and white creatures blocking or blocked by Abomination.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Alabaster Potion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb
cards.originalText: Give target player X life, or prevent X damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Aladdin's Lamp
cards.text: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

rulings.text: If you use more than one Lamp effect, the second one will end up replacing the card being drawn with the first one.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Instead of drawing a card from the top of your library, draw X cards but choose only one to put into your hand. Shuffle the leftover cards and put them at the bottom of your library. X cannot be 0.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.
cards.originalText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ali Baba
cards.text: {R}: Tap target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, ‘Open, Sesame!'"
—The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

rulings.text: This ability may be used to tap more than one Wall per turn if you have enough mana, since tapping isn't part of the activation cost.
The ability may tap walls even when Ali Baba is tapped or just entered the battlefield, since the activation cost doesn't include {T}.

cards.originalText: {R}: Tap target wall.

cards.name: Amrou Kithkin
cards.text: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

rulings.text: A creature with power 3 or greater can't be declared as a blocker for Amrou Kithkin. If the power of a creature that's already blocking Amrou Kithkin is increased to 3 or greater, it will continue to block Amrou Kithkin.

cards.originalText: No creature with power greater than 2 may be assigned to block Kithkin.

cards.name: Amulet of Kroog
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.
cards.originalText:
Trample
During your turn, Angry Mob has power and toughness each equal to 2 plus the total number of swamps opponents control. During other turns, Angry Mob has power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that's already a creature, it won't change its power and toughness.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Target artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its casting cost; target retains all its original abilities. Animate Artifact does not affect artifact creatures.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won't be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can't legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won't be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature's still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

cards.originalText: Take target creature from any graveyard and put it directly into play under your control with -1/-0. Treat this creature as though it were just summoned. If Animate Dead is removed, bury the creature in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

rulings.text: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

cards.originalText: Target wall can now attack.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.originalText: Each time a player puts a land into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Apprentice Wizard
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Armageddon Clock
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

rulings.text: Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, put one doom counter on Armageddon Clock. At the end of your upkeep, Armageddon Clock deals X damage to each player, where X is the number of doom counters on Armageddon Clock. During any upkeep, any player may pay {4} to remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock.

cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.
If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it's countered. It doesn't deal 5 damage to you.

cards.originalText: Ashes to Ashes removes two target non-artifact creatures from the game and deals 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.
cards.flavor: This invention shows why Ashnod was feared by her troops as well as her foes.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped. You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap phase.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

cards.originalText: Increase target creature's power and toughness by half the number of forests you control, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

cards.name: Backfire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to you, Backfire deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
cards.originalText: Backfire deals 1 damage to target creature's controller for each 1 damage dealt to you by that creature.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All black creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

rulings.text: First the player whose turn it is chooses which lands (if any) to keep, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by the players who chose before them. All of the unchosen lands are then sacrificed simultaneously. Then the process is repeated for cards in hand, except that no cards are revealed until all players have chosen what to discard, at which point those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Lastly, the process is repeated for creatures, and players will again know earlier choices made when deciding what to sacrifice. All of the unchosen creatures are then sacrificed simultaneously.
Balance doesn't have targets, so permanents that can't be targeted, such as a creature with shroud or protection from white, are valid choices to be sacrificed.

Each type of object is counted during the corresponding part of the process. Cards in hand are counted after lands have been sacrificed, and creatures on the battlefield are counted after cards have been discarded. Thus, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not be counted when determining how many creatures are on the battlefield for the last part.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices enough lands to equalize the number of lands all players control. The player who controls the fewest lands cannot sacrifice any in this way. All players then equalize cards in hand and then creatures in play in the same way.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Ball Lightning can attack the turn it comes into play. At the end of any turn, bury Ball Lightning.

cards.name: Battering Ram
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
cards.flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText:
Banding when attacking
At the end of combat, destroy all walls blocking Battering Ram.

cards.name: Benalish Hero
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.
cards.originalText: Protection from white, first strike

cards.name: Black Mana Battery
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Black Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Black Mana Battery: Add {B} to your mana pool, then add an additional {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

rulings.text: Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Put one charge counter on Black Mana Battery.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool and remove as many charge counters as you wish. For each charge counter removed from Black Mana Battery, add {B} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in his or her hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

cards.originalText: At the end of target opponent's upkeep, Black Vise deals that player 1 damage for each card in his or her hand in excess of four.

cards.name: Black Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from black. The protection granted by Black Ward does not destroy Black Ward.

cards.name: Blessing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {W}: Target creature Blessing enchants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blight
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
cards.originalText: If target land becomes tapped, destroy it at end of turn.

cards.name: Blood Lust
cards.text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

rulings.text: Has changed slightly in functionality, with the old continuous nature of the toughness reduction gone away; the toughness change remains static. For example, if you have three Swamps and Nightmare on the battlefield and then cast Blood Lust on it, it will become 7/1. If one of your Swamps is subsequently destroyed, your Nightmare will become 6/0 and be put in the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/-4 until end of turn. If this reduces creature's toughness to less than 1, creature's toughness becomes 1.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

cards.originalText: Counter target red spell or destroy target red permanent.

cards.name: Blue Mana Battery
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Blue Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Blue Mana Battery: Add {U} to your mana pool, then add an additional {U} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

rulings.text: Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Put one charge counter on Blue Mana Battery.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool and remove as many charge counters as you wish. For each charge counter removed from Blue Mana Battery, add {U} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Blue Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from blue. The protection granted by Blue Ward does not destroy Blue Ward.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}: Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman. Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. Otherwise, put a Djinn token into play. Treat this token as a 5/5 artifact creature with flying.

cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

rulings.text: This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.
If there are multiple combat phases during the turn, the attack cost must be paid each time if you want to attack with the creature.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.

cards.originalText: Target creature cannot attack unless its controller pays an additional {3}.

cards.name: Brass Man
cards.text:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Brass Man does not untap during your untap phase.
{1}: Untap Brass Man. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Bronze Tablet
cards.text:
Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped.
{4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If he or she does, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

rulings.text: If using a copy of the Tablet, you must trade the copy card to your opponent just like you would have traded the Tablet.
You can't choose to pay 10 life if you have less than 10 life, but you may choose to give up the game immediately. This has roughly the same effect.
You can take control of your opponent's Tablet and in the trade you only have to give them back their Tablet.
If the card being targeted by the Bronze Tablet is removed before Tablet takes effect, then the Tablet ability is countered and it remains tapped.

If the tablet is not still on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it is not exiled. The other player still has the choice to pay 10 life, and you still become the owner of their card if they choose not to do so.

cards.originalText:
Comes into play tapped.
{4}, {T}: Remove Bronze Tablet and target card opponent owns from the game. You become owner of opponent's card, and opponent becomes owner of Bronze Tablet. Opponent may prevent this exchange by paying 10 life; if he or she does so, destroy Bronze Tablet. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. Play this ability as an interrupt.
Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if not playing for ante.

cards.name: Brothers of Fire
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Burrowing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText: Target creature gains mountainwalk.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavor:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Carrion Ants
cards.text: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree.
cards.originalText: {1}: +1/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.originalText: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2 when not attacking.

cards.name: Cave People
cards.text:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText:
When attacking, Cave People gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Celestial Prism
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: You can't pay life you don't have. In other words, you can't Channel yourself below zero life.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool at a cost of 1 life per one mana. Play these additions as interrupts. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Chaoslace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to red. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {2}: Prevent all damage against you from one artifact source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {2} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one black source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one blue source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one green source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one red source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one white source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Clay Statue
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
cards.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.
cards.originalText: {2}: Regenerate

cards.name: Clockwork Avian
cards.text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Clockwork Avian comes into play, put four +1/+0 counters on it. At the end of any combat in which Clockwork Avian is assigned to attack or block, remove a counter.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. You may have no more than four of these counters on Clockwork Avian. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText:
When Clockwork Beast comes into play, put seven +1/+0 counters on it. At the end of any combat in which Clockwork Beast is assigned to attack or block, remove a counter.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. You may have no more than seven of these counters on Clockwork Beast. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by Cockatrice.

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor:
From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom:
Warrior born from a rocky womb.

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Colossus does not untap during your untap phase.
{9}: Untap Colossus. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Prevent up to 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature.

cards.name: Conversion
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

rulings.text: The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText: All mountains become basic plains. During your upkeep, pay {W}{W} or destroy Conversion.

cards.name: Coral Helm
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {3}: Discard a card at random from your hand to give target creature +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cosmic Horror
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.
cards.flavor: ". . . [S]creams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

rulings.text: If you choose not to pay Cosmic Horror's upkeep cost, it deals 7 damage to you only if it's actually destroyed. If it regenerates or an effect has given it indestructible, it deals no damage.

cards.originalText:
First strike
During your upkeep, pay {3}{B}{B}{B} or destroy Cosmic Horror. If you destroy Cosmic Horror in this way, it deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Creature Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.
cards.originalText: If target creature is put into the graveyard, Creature Bond deals damage equal to the creature's toughness to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Crimson Manticore
cards.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies.  As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact. Artifact's controller gains life equal to the artifact's casting cost.

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All white creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Gain 1 life for a successfully cast blue spell. Use this effect either when the spell is cast or later in the turn but only once for each blue spell cast.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Cursed Land deals 1 damage to target land's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Cursed Rack
cards.text:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.
cards.flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

rulings.text: The effect of lowering the maximum hand size makes it so the player discards down to 4 cards (instead of the usual 7) during the cleanup step.

You choose one opposing player just as this card is entering the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then a player puts Cursed Rack onto the battlefield choosing you, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: Target opponent discards down to four cards during his or her discard phase.

cards.name: Cyclopean Mummy
cards.text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.
cards.flavor: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.

rulings.text: The Mummy does go to the graveyard and trigger abilities which watch for something going to the graveyard. It then gets exiled as a triggered ability.
It does not get exiled if it goes to the graveyard from someplace other than the battlefield. This includes discarding from your hand or if the spell is countered.

cards.originalText: If Mummy is put into the graveyard from play, remove it from the game.

cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.
cards.originalText: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Deathlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to black. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.
cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact. Detonate deals X damage to the artifact's controller, where X is the casting cost of the artifact.

cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
cards.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor
cards.originalText: {3}: Regenerate

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Each time a player puts a land into the graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment or artifact.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. The target cannot regenerate until end of turn. If the target receives lethal damage this turn, remove it from the game entirely.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player chooses and discards one card from his or her hand. Use this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Divine Transformation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.
cards.originalText: {2}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ." —Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

rulings.text: The first three times Dragon Whelp's ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp's ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp's ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. You'll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn. If you spend more than {R}{R}{R} in this way during one turn, destroy Dragon Whelp at end of turn.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

cards.originalText: Drain Life deals 1 damage to a target creature or player for each {B} you pay in addition to the casting cost. You then gain 1 life for each 1 damage dealt. You cannot gain more life than the toughness of the creature or the total life of the player Drain Life damages.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.

rulings.text: This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land he or she controls has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
Your opponent may use instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

cards.originalText: Target player must draw all mana from his or her available lands; then, all mana in target player's mana pool drains into your mana pool.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

cards.name: Dwarven Warriors
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: The ability can be activated after a creature is blocked, but it has no effect. Once a creature is blocked, it can't be unblocked.
If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power no greater than 2 becomes unblockable until end of turn. Other effects may later be used to increase the creature's power beyond 2.

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavor: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying.
